etymologies: from an alleged African word for a wild or hairy person, found in the Greek account of the voyage of the Carthaginian explorer Hanno in the 5th or 6th century BC; adopted in 1847 as the specific name of the ape

definitions: a powerfully built great ape with a large head and short neck, found in the forests of central Africa. It is the largest living primate.

notes.text: Gorilla gorilla, family Pongidae: three races (two lowland gorillas and the mountain gorilla)

shortDefinitions: powerfully built great ape with large head and short neck, found in forests of central Africa

definitions: a dominant contender within a particular sphere of operation or activity

examples.text: the 800-lb gorilla of the home mortgage industry

shortDefinitions: dominant contender within particular sphere of operation or activity
